prompt: Give me the best speech to text solutions.

hidden_queries: top speech to text services and software comparison

sources.title: Transcribe audio with Google Gemini for free - here's how to do it
sources.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here’s a direct, up-to-date list of the best speech-to-text solutions (for different needs: developers, business, mobile, offline, collaborative meetings) based on recent reviews and comparisons: Top enterprise/cloud developer APIs Google Cloud Speech-to-Text / Gemini transcription – highly accurate, customizable models, supports real-time streaming & batch, strong for apps. Influencer Marketing Hub+1

sources.title: Best speech-to-text app of 2025
sources.snippet:
This comprehensive 2025 TechRadar guide ranks the top speech-to-text apps and services designed to simplify converting spoken language into written text across mobile, desktop, and cloud platforms. Speech-to-text tools have moved from niche uses to broader applications in business, education, and everyday productivity. As voice recognition accuracy has greatly improved, many platforms now boast around 99% transcription accuracy.

Key offerings include:

- **Speechmatics**, praised for its multilingual, accent-flexible AI-driven transcription tools.
- **Dragon Professional**, ideal for business use with high accuracy and productivity tools.
- **Otter**, optimized for mobile and collaborative note-taking during meetings.
- **Verbit**, tailored for enterprise and education with hybrid AI and human transcription.
- **Braina Pro**, a PC-based voice assistant offering versatile command and dictation support.
- **Microsoft Azure Speech to Text** and **IBM Watson**, both cloud-native enterprise solutions offering real-time and batch transcription with customizable language models.
- **Dragon Anywhere**, a mobile app delivering professional-grade dictation in the cloud.
- **Amazon Transcribe**, optimized for business use with live and batch processing.

Top free options include Google Gboard, Just Press Record, Speechnotes, and built-in features like Windows Speech Recognition. Additional apps like iTranslate, Voice Notes, and SpeechTexter highlight specialized capabilities for translation, note organization, and social media use. The guide concludes with advising selection based on user needs and testing methodology.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Verbit – hybrid AI + human option for high-accuracy, enterprise captioning/transcription. TechRadar
